sources.full: Light Party 5e - A Final Fantasy XIV conversion to Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your tough scales provide you extra protection. When you aren’t wearing armor, your base AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Cranial Horns
entries: Your horns grant you an enhanced sense of perception and spatial awareness. You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in two melee weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As an au ra, you come from either the raen or xaela clans, each of which gives you different benefits.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As an elezen, you hail from one of two clans; either the duskwight or wildwood. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Weapon Smith
entries: Your people are known for crafting unique weapons. You have proficiency in your choice of Smith’s Tools or Tinker’s Tools.

entries.name: Courage and Fealty
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being Charmed or Frightened.

entries.name: Bolstering Roar
entries: As a bonus action, you let out a battle cry that rouses your fighting spirit. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
This trait gains an additional effect based on your choice of subrace.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a hrothgar, you belong to one of two clans, the Helion or the Lost. While the two clans have little-to-no physical differences, slight differences in history and culture give you unique features. Choose from either the Helion or Lost clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Broad Skillset
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, one tool or gaming set of your choice, and you know one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Adaptable
entries: You are adept at adjusting to unfamiliar situations. When you make an attack roll, ability check or saving throw that doesn’t already include your proficiency bonus, you can choose to add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to that roll.

entries.name: Migratory
entries: Your body is built for long journeys on foot. You have advantage on saving throws against Exhaustion caused by a forced march during travel.

entries.name: Fast Learner
entries: It takes you half as much time to learn a new language or set of tools.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a hyur, you descend from one of two clans; either the Midlander or Highlander clans. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Lalafellin Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Scurry
entries: You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action. Whenever you take the Disengage action, your speed increases by 5 feet until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Tradesmen
entries: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a lalafell, you descend from one of two clans; either the Plainsfolk and Dunesfolk clans. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 35 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colours in that darkness only as shades of grey.

entries.name: Keen Awareness
entries: Your senses have been honed by generations of hunting. You have a +2 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score and to any Wisdom (Perception) checks you make.

entries.name: Hunter's Stride
entries: You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a miqo’te, you belong to either the Seekers of the Sun clan, or the Keepers of the Moon clan. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying weight and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Roegadyn Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Endless Stamina
entries: You can use your action to tap into the endless well of stamina within you. You regain a number of hit points equal to your level, and reduce your exhaustion level, if any, by 1. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: Among roegadyn, there are two distinct clans, each with their own unique physiology and cultures. Choose from the sea wolf or hellsguard subraces.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 35 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump distance increases by 10 feet, and your high jump increases by 5 feet. You also don’t need a running start to gain the full effects of a jump.

entries.name: Long Fall
entries: Making your home in the trees teaches you to fall from them safely. When you fall and aren’t incapacitated, you can subtract up to 20 feet from the fall when calculating the fall’s damage.

entries.name: Hidden Hunter
entries: You can take the Hide action as a bonus action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: The different lifestyles and adaptations of the rava and veena clan provide slight but meaningful differences in the two. Choose from the rava or veena subraces.

entries.name: Social Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Insight, Performance or Persuasion.

entries.name: Loyalty
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

entries.name: Will of Azim
entries: When you make a saving throw and fail, you can use your reaction to roll a d6 and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
As a member of the auri raen clan, you have integrated into the cultures of the Far East, granting you unique traits that reflects your social nature and iron will.

entries.name: Warrior's Insight
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Athletics or Intimidation.

entries.name: Nomadic Wanderer
entries: Hardened by many years of wandering the steppe, your walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Might of Nhaama
entries: When you make a weapon attack and miss, you can use your reaction to roll a d6 and add it to the roll, potentially turning the miss into a hit. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
As a member of the auri xaela clan, you are part of a nomadic warrior culture, granting you unique traits that reflects your combat skill and fiery will.

entries.name: Traditional Tools
entries: You have proficiency in your choice of mason’s tools or potter’s tools.

entries.name: Sensitive Hearing
entries: Thanks to your sensitive ears, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on hearing.
Additionally, you can take the Search action as a bonus action, using the uncanny awareness granted by your senitive hearing to listen for signs of enemies.

The duskwight elezen dwell in the caves beneath the black shroud. Many years of living in the dark, dank tunnels have blessed them with phenomenal hearing. Their traditions hold fast to the arts of stonecarving and pottery.

entries.name: Gridanian Training
entries: You have proficiency with shortbows and longbows. Additionally, you gain proficiency in one of the following musical instruments of your choice: flute, lute, lyre or viol.

entries.name: Hawk Shot
entries: Your impeccable eyesight allows you to make attacks at long range. When you make a ranged attack, you can increase the range of the attack by 30 feet. If the attack uses a weapon, both the long and normal ranges are increased.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn.

The wildwood elezen primarily hail from the forest city of Gridania. Their ancestors created the arts of archery and string musical instruments, traditions which are taught to most wildwood elezen in the modern day. They also possess fantastic eyesight, which aids in their use of ranged weapons.

entries.name: Holy Scriptures
entries: You have proficiency in the Religion skill. Additionally, you have advantage on checks made to recall information about the goddess Halone.

entries.name: Halone's Fury
entries: You can channel your holy fervour through your weapons. When you hit a target with a simple or martial weapon, you can cause the target to take extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn.
For generations the proud city of Ishgard stood as a beacon for the virtues of the church. The people’s devotion to their religion has given rise to a devout and noble culture.

entries.name: Roar of Fealty
entries: When you use your Bolstering Roar, you end the Charmed condition on yourself and creatures of your choice within 10 feet.
The life of a helion revolves around their queen. Helions are unwavering in their loyalty, both to their queen and their allies.

entries.name: Roar of Courage
entries: When you use your Bolstering Roar, you end the Frightened condition on yourself and creatures of your choice within 10 feet.
Having lost or abandoned their queen, The Lost value their freedom and travel the world in search of new meaning.

entries.name: Natural Companion
entries: You have proficiency in the Persuasion skill.

entries.name: Tool Master
entries: Choose one of your tool proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your chosen tool.
Midlanders are widespread and quickly adopt the social norms of where they settle. They are naturally amicable with the people they meet, and put particular focus into mastering their professions.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You are proficient in two martial weapons of your choice.
Highlanders are much less populous, and hail primarily from the mountains of Gyr Abania. Their bodies and cultures have been harded by generations of conflict.

entries.name: Natural Insight
entries: You have proficiency in the Insight skill.

entries.name: Loyalty
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.
Like most Hyur, those in the far east are adaptable, but have unique traits brought about by their wildly different cultures.

entries.name: Natural Naturalist
entries: You have proficiency in the Nature skill.

entries.name: Padjali Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.
Padjal are horned, youthful Hyur rarely born within the Black Shroud. Ironically, they are not a natural occurence; rather, they are gifted power from birth by the Elementals.

entries.name: Agrarian Folk
entries: You have proficiency in the Nature skill.

entries.name: Prarie Camoflague
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in grassland or forest terrain.
The Plainsfolk inhabit the grasslands of western Eorzea, primarily on the island of Vylbrand, but some have made their way east and settled in the lands in and around the Black Shroud.

entries.name: Merchant Folk
entries: You have proficiency in the Deception skill.

entries.name: Acclimatised
entries: You are naturally adapted to harsh desert heat. You are immune to the effects of extreme heat.

entries.name: Dust Shield
entries: Your eyes are covered in a thin membrane that keeps out desert sands and sunlight. You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded.
The Dunesfolk dwell in the deserts of Thanalan, and are naturally adapted to the harsh climates therein.

entries.name: Miner Folk
entries: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

entries.name: Heavy Handed
entries: You ignore the Heavy property of weapons.

entries.name: Strong Stomach
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against the Poisoned condition.

On The First, a parallel world to the one that contains Eorzea, Lalafell are known as Dwarves. A similarly stout and hardy folk, they dwell in the northern mountains of Norvrandt, and are known for their face-obscuring helmets and beard-like scarves.

entries.name: Superior Dash
entries: When you take the Dash action, your gain an additional 15 feet of movement for the current turn.

entries.name: Natural Climber
entries: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Seekers of the Sun are diurnal hunters, and frequently worshippers of Azeyama, the Warden. They possess fierce agility and stamina, capable of chasing prey through the desert heat with ease, and thanks to their natural talent for climbing, they often find work as sailors.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the dark of night, you have even greater darkvision than that of your cousins. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern colour in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Veil of the Moon
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in darkness.

Nocturnal hunters with a matriarchal society, the Keepers of the Moon are frequently worshippers of Menphina. They make their home in the cool, dark barrows of the Black Shroud, hunting the forest’s myriad beasts and trading the spoils in exchange for agricultural goods.

entries.name: Natural Swimmer
entries: Thanks to your life at sea, you have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Sea Legs
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone.

entries.name: Navigator
entries: You have proficiency in navigator’s tools.

Descended from the pirates that plagued the Northern Empty, the Sea Wolves are most at home on the seas or in the maritime city of Limsa Lominsa. True to their roots, many make a name for themselves as pirates, navigators of fishermen.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Navigator
entries: You have proficiency in smith's tools.

Making their home in the rugged mountains of Abalathia’s Spine, the Hellsguard are few in number but great in spirit. They are proud warriors, with bodies and spirits tempered by the unforgiving heat of their volcanic homeland.

entries.name: Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in two martial weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Fearless
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
A common site in the Far East and even amongst the forces of Garlemald, the Othardian Roegadyn resemble the Hellsguard in appearance, though with paler skin that sets them apart.

entries.name: Nature's Step
entries: Accustomed to weaving through the dense foliage of the jungle, you can move through nonmagical difficult terrain without expending extra movement, if you are using your walking speed on the ground or a floor.

entries.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in jungle or forest terrain.
Dwelling in the Golmore Jungle, the Rava’s umber skin helps them blend into the forest to ambush their prey.

entries.name: Mountain Acclimation
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You also naturally acclimate to high altitudes, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.
Making their homes in the forests surrounding the Skatay Range, the Veena are well adapted to their mountainous, snowcapped surroundings.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Attuned to the stars above, you can cast astrologian spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the astrologian spell list. You learn additional astrologian cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Astrologian table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Astrologian table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your astrologian spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these astrologian spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of astrologian spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the astrologian spell list. When you do so, choose a number of astrologian spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your astrologian level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level astrologian, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn’t remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of astrologian spells requires time spent studying the stars: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your astrologian spells. The power of your spells comes from the stars above and your attunement to them. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an astrologian spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast an astrologian spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an astrolabe as a spellcasting focus for your astrologian spells.

classFeature.name: Fate Arcana
entries: At 1st level you are able to draw cards from your deck of sixty and instill them with cosmic magic to create powerful effects.

Fate Die. Your arcana cards make use of a special die called a Fate Die. At 1st level your Fate Die is a d6. Your Fate Die increases in size as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Fate Die column of the Astrologian table.

Draw. When you finish a long rest, you can draw a number of cards up to your Wisdom modifier. For each card you draw, roll on the Fate Arcana table using your Fate Die to determine which card you draw. Your drawn cards retain their potency until you next finish a long rest, until you play the card to bestow an effect, or until the card is discarded.
When you finish a short or long rest, you can choose one of your drawn fate cards to discard, then draw a new card in its place.

Play. As an action, you can choose a creature within 30 feet of you (you can choose yourself) and play one of your drawn arcana cards, bestowing its effect to that creature. If the card effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals your spell save DC.

entries.caption: Fate Arcana
rows: The target can use its reaction to move a number of feet equal to 5 times a roll of your Fate Die without provoking opportunity attacks. For 1 minute, the creature’s speed increases by 10 feet.
For the next minute, the target can add a roll of your Fate Die to any damage roll it makes.
The target regains hit points equal to two rolls of your Fate Die + your Wisdom modifier. For 1 minute, the target regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns.
For 1 minute, the target is immune to being Charmed, and the target can add a roll of your Fate Die to any Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma check it makes.

The target chooses up to five creatures within 30 feet of itself to be wrapped in celestial chains. The creatures must make a Strength saving throw, taking radiant damage equal to a roll of your Fate Die + your Wisdom modifier on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw is restrained for one minute (escape DC equals your spell save dc)
The target gains temporary hit points equal to a roll of your Fate Die + your Wisdom modifier. While it has these temporary hit points, the target has a +2 bonus to AC.
For 1 minute, the creature can make one additional weapon attack when it takes the Attack action.
For 1 minute, the creature can cast cantrips with a casting time of 1 action as a bonus action.

The target and creatures of your choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking radiant damage equal to three rolls of your Fate Die + your Wisdom modifier on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

Celestial daggers manifest in a 15-foot radius around the target that moves with the target. Any creature starting its turn in the radius or that enters there for the first time on a turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes damage equal to a roll of your Fate Die + your Wisdom modifier, or half as much on a success.
Roll your Fate Die. The target creature regains one expended spell slot of its choice of a level equal to or lower than half the number rolled on your Fate Die (rounded down)

The target can choose a creature within 30 feet of it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes radiant damage equal to two rolls of your Fate Die and is charmed by the target. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and isn’t charmed. If the charmed creature moves more than 30 feet away from the target, it takes radiant damage equal to two rolls of your Fate Die and becomes frightened of the target.

classFeature.name: Astral Sect
entries: At 2nd level, you delve into one of the astral sects, groups of astrologians that attune themselves to specific heavenly bodies, becoming one with the myriad powers of the cosmos. Choose from the Solar Sect, Lunar Sect, Comet Sect, Binary Sect or Meteor Sect, each of which is detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level, and then again at 6th level, 10th level and 14th level.

entries.name: Sect Spells
entries: Each sect has a list of spells – its sect spells – that you gain at the astrologian levels noted in the sect description. Once you gain a sect spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you have a sect spell that doesn’t appear on the astrologian spell list, the spell is nonetheless an astrologian spell for you.

classFeature.name: Fate Teller
entries: At 3rd level, you can use your attunement to the stars and deck of sixty to gain glimpses into the future. You have the {@spell augury} spell prepared, which doesn’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. You can cast the augury spell once without expending a spell slot, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you cast augury, it has no verbal or somatic components, and only uses your deck of sixty as a material component.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the astrologian spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the astrologian spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the astrologian spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the astrologian spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the astrologian spell list

classFeature.name: Astral Sect Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Astral Sect.

classFeature.name: Astral Sect Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Astral Sect.

classFeature.name: Astral Sect Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Astral Sect.

classFeature.name: Chosen Fate
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you draw a fate arcana card, instead of rolling you can choose which card you draw. You can do so only once each time you draw cards at the end of a long rest.

classFeature.name: Cosmic Omen
entries: When you reach 20th level, you are able to take hold of another creature’s fate. When you or a creature you can see succeeds or fails on an attack roll, saving throw or ability check, you can use your reaction to force it to become the opposite; failing if it succeeded, or succeeding if it failed. You can use this reaction twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Gunblade
entries: In your training, you have learned how to design and build your own gunblades. Over the course of an hour, you can use smith’s tools to convert a melee weapon into a gunblade. You can have up to two gunblades at once. If you attempt to construct a third, you must dissasemble one of your existing gunblades, converting it back into a normal melee weapon. A weapon you convert into a gunblade gains the following properties:
Weighty. Only you know how to wield the unique weight of your gunblade. If another creature tries to use your gunblade, it cannot add it’s proficiency bonus to the attack roll.

Lightning Shot. You can use your gunblade to make a simple ranged attack. The attack has a range of 30 feet and you are proficient with it. The attack uses your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, the damage die is a {@dice 1d6}, and it deals lightning damage.
Additionally, when you reach 6th level, your gunblades count as magical for the purposes of overcoming weakness and resistance.

classFeature.name: Cartridges
entries: Also at 1st level, you have a number of aether–charged catridges that you can swiftly load into your gunblade and fire to unleash powerful cartridge features. You begin knowing three such features: Blasting Zone, Burst Strike and Heart of Stone. You learn more cartridge features as you gain levels in this class.
You must be wielding a gunblade to be able to fire a cartridge. A cartridge is expended after it is fired, and you regain all expended cartridges after finishing a short or long rest.
Some of your gunbreaker features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Blasting Zone
entries: As an action, you can fire a cartridge to instantly destroy a nonmagical, Medium or smaller object within reach of a gunblade you are wielding.
When you reach 11th level, the object can be Large or smaller, and when you reach 17th level, the object can be Huge or smaller.

classFeature.name: Burst Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack using a gunblade, you can fire a cartridge to follow up with a deadly blast. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 2d8} fire damage and is knocked prone. On a failed save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect. If the attack was a critical hit, the creature automatically fails the saving throw.

When you reach 11th level, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}, and instead of knocking a creature prone on a failed save, you can push it back up to 15 feet. When you reach 17th level, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}.

classFeature.name: Heart of Stone
entries: When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to fire a cartridge, creating a magical barrier around the target, that reduces the damage taken by {@dice 1d8} + your Constitution modifier (minimum reduction of 1).
When you reach 11th level, the range increases to 60 feet, and when you reach 17th level, the range increases to 90 feet.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Brutal Shell
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you are able to use the excess aether from your cartridges defensively. Whenever you fire a cartridge, and you gain 5 temporary hit points which last for 1 minute.

Additionally, when you use Heart of Stone and target another creature, you can choose to have that creature gain the temporary hit points from this feature, rather than you. When you do so, the temporary hit points last until the start of the creature’s next turn.
When you reach 11th level, the number of temporary hit points you gain increases to 10, and when you reach 17th level, it increases to 15.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you undergo specialised training, joining a contingent of like-minded gunbreakers. Through your contingent, you learn unique techniques and abilities to use in conjunction with your gunblade. Choose from the Queen’s Guard, Ravager, Elementalist or Shadowhunter Contingents, each of which is presented at the end of the class description. The contingent you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Deft Hands
entries: By 6th level, you have become more adept at handling your gunblade and tools. You can convert a weapon into a gunblade in half the time it would normally take, and you can repair objects using your smith’s tools twice as fast. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using Smith’s Tools.

classFeature.name: Gunblade Improvement
entries: At 6th level, your gunblade counts as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Contingent.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Heart of Light
entries: Starting at 9th level, whenever a creature you can see forces you to make a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect, you can use your reaction to fire a cartridge and release a surge of defensive energy. You and any other creature within 30 feet that was also forced to make the saving throw have advantage on the roll.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Contingent.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Enforcer
entries: At 13th level, your imposing presence emboldens your allies. When you or a creature within 30 feet of you makes a Charisma check, the creature gains a bonus to the roll equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of +1). You must be conscious and visible to grant this bonus.

classFeature.name: Continuation
entries: At 14th level, you are able to capitalise on the momentum from your gunblade. When you hit a creature with a melee attack using a gunblade, you can fire a cartridge as a bonus action to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature suffers one of the following effects of your choice:
Abdomen Tear. The creature has disadvantage on the next Strength or Dexterity saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.
Eye Gouge. The creature is blinded until the end of your next turn.
Jugular Rip. The creature can’t cast any spells that require a verbal component, and can speak only falteringly until the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Contingent.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Bloodfest
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you roll initiative and have no cartridges remaining, you regain 2 cartridges.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Gunmetal Soul
entries: By the time you reach 20th level, your body and soul has been hardened by war. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. Additionally, whenever you use Heart of Stone and target another creature, you can extend this benefit to them. The creature gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage until the start of its next turn, including against the triggering damage.

classFeature.name: Disciplined Fist
entries: At 1st level, your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of the unique combat style of your order. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can use a d6 in place of the normal damage dice of your unarmed strikes or melee weapons. This die changes as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Discipline column of the Monk table.
Your unarmed strike can deal your choice of bludgeoning, slashing or piercing damage.
Your unarmed strike counts as a melee weapon for the purpose of any feature, effect or spell that requires a melee weapon.
Your melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes deal double damage against objects and structures.

entries: You can’t gain these benefits if you are wearing armour, wielding a shield, or wielding a weapon with the two-handed or heavy properties.

classFeature.name: Combat Forms
entries: Also at 1st level, you have mastered unique combat forms to give you an edge in battle. You have three combat forms; Coeurl form, Opo-Opo form and Raptor form. Each form grants you unique benefits while you are maintaining that form, as specified in the form’s description.

When you start your turn, you can assume a combat form of your choice, or assume a different form if you are already maintaining a form. You can maintain your chosen form indefinitely, so long as you are not wearing armour, wielding a shield, or wielding a weapon with the two-handed or heavy properties. You also lose your current form if you are knocked prone, grappled or incapacitated.

{@b {@i Coeurl Form}}. An aggressive stance based on the Coeurl’s hunting prowess. While in Coeurl form, you have a +2 bonus to damage rolls of your melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes using Strength, and you can use a bonus action on your turn to make one unarmed strike. When you reach 9th level, the damage bonus increases to +3, and at 17th level, it increases to +4.}

{@b {@i Opo-Opo Form}}. A defensive stance based on the Opo-Opo’s evasive nature. While in Opo-Opo form, you have a +1 bonus to AC, and you can use a bonus action on your turn to take the Disengage action. When you reach 9th level, the AC bonus increases to +2, and at 17th level, it increases to +3.}

{@b {@i Raptor Form}}. A swift stance based on the Raptor’s impressive mobility. While in Raptor form, your speed increases by 10 feet, and you can use a bonus action on your turn to take the Dash action. When you reach 9th level, the bonus speed increases to 20 feet, and at 17th level, it increases to 30 feet.}

classFeature.name: Combat Forms Improvement
entries: At 9th level, your combat forms improve.

classFeature.name: Combat Forms Improvement
entries: At 17th level, your combat forms improve again.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Strength modifier.

classFeature.name: Mantra
entries: At 2nd level, you can focus on a mantra to quell your mind and spirit during meditation. When you finish a short or long rest, choose one of the following mantras. You gain the benefit of your chosen mantra until you use this feature again. You must spend at least 10 minutes of the rest meditating and repeating your mantra to do so.
{@bold {@i Riddle of the Body.}} You ruminate on your understanding of the physical body. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and your jump height and distance is doubled.
{@bold {@i Riddle of the Mind.}} You ruminate on your understanding of the conscious mind. You can understand any language spoken by another creature.

classFeature.name: Masterful Blitz
entries: Also at 2nd level, your understanding of your chakra allows you to unleash devastating techniques.

{@bold {@i Chakra.}} You have access to two chakra. Your monk level determines the number of chakra you have, as shown in the Chakra column of the Monk table. You use your chakra to fuel and unleash your blitz techniques. Once you use a chakra, it is unavailable to you until you finish a short or long rest. Your use of chakra represents the closing of open chakra gates, and when you finish a rest, your meditation and focus allow you to reopen your gates.

{@bold {@i Blitz Techniques.}} You know two blitz techniques of your choice, which are presented at the end of the class description. You learn more blitz techniques as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Techniques Known column of the Monk table. When you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the blitz techniques you know and replace it with another technique you meet the requirements for. When you use a technique, you spend a number of Chakra up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) to fuel it, increasing its power for each chakra you spend.
{@bold {@i Form Requirements.}} Your blitz techniques require you to be maintaining a specific form in order to use it, as specified in its description.
{@bold {@i Saving throws.}} Some of your techniques require your target to make a saving throw to resist the technique’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Monastic Brotherhood
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself wholly to a monastic brotherhood, splinters of the original Fist of Rhalgr sect that commit themselves to studying and understanding one of the fundamental elements of Rhalgr’s doctrine and the world. Choose from the Brotherhood of Fire, Brotherhood of Earth, Brotherhood of Wind, Brotherhood of Water or Brotherhood of Void. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 6th, 14th and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Monastic Brotherhood Feature
entries: When you reach 6th level, you gain a feature from your monastic brotherhood.

classFeature.name: Monastic Brotherhood Feature
entries: When you reach 14th level, you gain a feature from your monastic brotherhood.

classFeature.name: Monastic Brotherhood Feature
entries: When you reach 18th level, you gain a feature from your monastic brotherhood.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Rhalgr's Blessing
entries: Starting at 6th level, the damage of your unarmed strikes and Masterful Blitz techniques counts as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity.

classFeature.name: Purification
entries: At 7th level, your mastery over the aether flowing through you allows you to rid your body of harmful effects. You can spend one chakra as an action to end either the blinded, deafened or poisoned condition on yourself.
Alternatively, you can spend three chakra to end one effect that is reducing your Strength, Dexterity or Constitution score, or one effect reducing your hit point maximum.

classFeature.name: Forms of Might
entries: At 10th level, your mastery over the ways of Rhalgr improves your combat forms in the following ways.
{@b {@i Coeurl Form}} You have advantage on the first attack roll you make while in Coeurl form.
{@b {@i Opo-Opo Form}} While in Opo-Opo form, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
{@b {@i Raptor Form}} When you take the Dash action while in Raptor Form, opportunity attacks made against you have disadvantage until the end of your turn.

classFeature.name: Perfect Balance
entries: From 11th level, when you start your turn, you can spend 3 chakra to enter a special stance, gaining all the benefits of Coeurl, Opo-Opo and Raptor form until the start of your next turn. While in this stance, you can also use any Masterful Blitz technique you know without needing to meet the form requirement.

classFeature.name: Improved Mantra
entries: Starting at 13th level, you become more attuned to your spiritual self. When you finish a short or long rest, you can choose two mantras to gain the benefits of, rather than only one. Moreover, when you perform a mantra as part of a short rest, you can roll any hit dice you spend twice and choose either result.

classFeature.name: Formless Technique
entries: At 15th level, you have practised one of your techniques to utter perfection. Choose one of the Masterful Blitz techniques you know. You can use that technique without needing to meet the form requirements.
When you reach 20th level, you can choose another technique to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Formless Technique
entries: When you reach 20th level, you can choose another masterful blitz technique to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Enlightenment
entries: When you reach 20th level, your martial and spiritual training reaches its absolute peak. Your Strength and Wisdom scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

classFeature.name: Darkside
entries: You harbour a well of darkness within you, fueled by your negative emotions, that ebbs and flows as you wield it. As a bonus action, you can tap into that darkness, and succumb to your darkside for 1 minute. Your darkside ends early you are knocked unconscious or choose to end it as a bonus action.
{@b {@i Darkside Die.}} Your darkside makes use of a special die called a Darkside die, which starts as a d6.

{@b {@i Changing the Die's Size.}} When your darkside ends, your Darkside die decreases by one size. For example, if the die is a d6, it becomes a d4. If it’s a d4, your darkside die fizzles out, and you are unable to use it until the die increases in size again, to at least a d4. If your darkside die fizzles out while you are succumbing to your darkside, your darkside immediately ends.

Your Darkside die increases by one die size when you finish a short rest, up to its starting size. When you finish a long rest, your Darkside die resets to its starting size. You can also use an action to increase your darkside die by one size, but you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
The starting size of your Darkside die changes as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Darkside Die column of the Dark Knight table.
{@b {@i Darkside Effects.}} While succumbing to your darkside, you gain the following benefits:

items: When hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you deal additional necrotic damage equal to a roll of your Darkside die.
When you make a Wisdom or Charisma check, you can roll your Darkside die and add the result to the check.
You are immune to being frightened.

classFeature.name: Sense Intent
entries: Yours is a power fueled by emotion, and using it, you can sense the intent and sentiment behind another’s acts. As an action, you can focus your awareness on a creature you can see within 60 feet and make a Wisdom (Insight) check contested by the target’s Deception (Charisma) check. If you succeed, you learn the creature’s alignment, as well as it’s intentions towards yourself or another creature. A creature is immune to this effect if it is hidden from Divination magic, or any effect that prevents its thoughts and emotions from being read.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier. When you finish a long rest, you regain all expended uses.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By 2nd level, you have learned to use the esoteric nature of your inner darkness to cast spells.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Dark Knigt table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your dark knight spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell Siphon Strike and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast Siphone Strike using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the dark knight spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Dark Knight table shows when you learn more dark knight spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the dark knight spells you know and replace it with another spell from the dark knight spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your dark knight spells, since your magic draws on your emotions and your control over them. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a dark knight spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your dark knight spells.

entries.name: Darkside Spellcasting
entries: While succumbing to your darkside, you don’t need to provide any components for your spells, except for material components that are consumed or have a gold cost.

classFeature.name: The Blackest Night
entries: Finally, at 2nd level you can expend one spell slot as an action to protect either yourself or a creature you can see within 30 feet. The chosen creature gains {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d6} for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d6}. The temporary hit points last until the end of the creature’s next turn.

classFeature.name: Dark Order
entries: At 3rd level, you choose to train under and join forces with one of several different dark knight orders. Choose from the Order of Blackguards, Order of Living Shadow, Order of Crimson, Order of the Sullen or Order of Penance. Your choice of order grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th and 15th level.

entries.name: Order Spells
entries: Each dark order has a list of spells – its order spells – that you gain at the dark knight levels noted in the order description. These spells count as dark knight spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of dark knight spells you know.

classFeature.name: Dark Order Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature from your choice of Dark Order.

classFeature.name: Dark Order Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature from your choice of Dark Order.

classFeature.name: Dark Order Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature from your choice of Dark Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Stalwart Soul
entries: At 6th level, you can attune with your inner darkness to grant yourself strength. When you make a Charisma saving throw while succumbing to your darkside, you can roll your Darkside die and add the result to the saving throw.
If you would fail the saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead by channeling your darkside. Once you succeed on a Charisma saving throw this way, your darkside die decreases by one size.

classFeature.name: Shadowskin
entries: At 10th level, the power of the abyss permeates your very being. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to necrotic damage.
When you enter your darkside, you gain temporary hit points equal to a roll of your darkside die.
While you have temporary hit points from a dark knight feature or spell, including this feature, you are instead immune to necrotic damage.

classFeature.name: Improved Sense Intent
entries: Starting at 14th level, your capacity to sense intentions grows stronger. When you use Sense Intent, you can target a number of creatures up to your Charisma modififer and if you succeed on the check against a creature, you have advantage on Charisma checks to interact with that creature.

classFeature.name: Dark Mind
entries: When you reach 18th level, your mind is an impregnable fortress, reinforced by your darkside. You are immune to having your thoughts or emotions read, as well as to any feature that would reveal your alignment. While succumbing to your darkside, you cannot be targeted divination magic and are hidden from magical scrying sensors.

classFeature.name: Darkside Mastery
entries: When you reach 20th level, you have the utmost control over your darkside. When you roll initiative and your darkside die is smaller than a d6 or fizzled out, it increases by one size.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: You have studied the art of black magic and have become able to cast black mage spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the black mage spell list. You learn additional black mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Black Mage table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Black Mage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your black mage spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these black mage spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell burning hands and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast burning hands using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the black mage spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Black Mage table shows when you learn more black mage spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the black mage spells you know and replace it with another spell from the black mage spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your black mage spells, since you learn your spells through study, memorization and practice. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a black mage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your black mage spells

classFeature.name: Ley Lines
entries: At 1st level, you can draw on the aether of the world around you to enhance your spells. When you use your action to cast a spell, you can at the same time draw on a strand of that magic to weave together ley lines in a 5-foot radius circle centered on you. Your ley lines remain there for 1 minute, and you cannot create another radius of ley lines until the previous one ends. When standing in your ley lines, you gain the following effects:

items: When you cast a spell while standing in your ley lines, you gain a +2 bonus to your spell save DC and your spell attack modifier. This bonus increases when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Ley Lines Bonus column of the Black Mage table.
When you use your action to Ready a spell, you don’t need to concentrate on the readied spell. You lose the readied spell if you leave your ley lines and you are not concentrating on it.
After you cast a spell in your ley lines, your speed is 0 until the end of your turn.

classFeature.name: Arcane Practice
entries: At 2nd level, you choose an arcane practice to focus your magical development in. Choose from the Pyromancer, Cryomancer, Mhachian, Void Mage or Black Cloud practices, each of which is presented at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level, and again at 6th, 14th and 18th level.

entries.name: Practice Spells
entries: Each arcane practice has a list of spells – its practice spells – that you gain at the black mage levels noted in the practice description. These spells count as black mage spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of black mage spells you know.

classFeature.name: Arcane Practice Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your choice of Arcane Practice.

classFeature.name: Arcane Practice Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your choice of Arcane Practice.

classFeature.name: Arcane Practice Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature from your choice of Arcane Practice.

classFeature.name: Aether Alignment
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can align your aether with the astral or umbral poles. You can spend 10 minutes in deep meditation to enter your choice of astral phase or umbral phase. This meditation can be performed as part of a short or long rest. You remain in your chosen alignment until you choose a different one using this feature, and your chosen alignment grants you benefits when you cast spells using a spell slot while standing in your ley lines.

entries.name: Astral Phase
entries: You attune to the sporradic and volatile astral pole. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals acid, fire, lightning, psychic or radiant damage, you can roll the damage dice twice and choose either result. Moreover, you deal additional damage equal to the level of the spell.

entries.name: Umbral Phase
entries: You attune to the static and unchanging umbral pole. When you cast a spell of 2nd level or higher that deals cold, force, necrotic, poison or thunder damage, you regain one expended spell slot. The slot you regain must be of a level lower than the spell you cast and can’t be higher than 5th level.

classFeature.name: Enochian
entries: Starting at 6th level, while standing in your ley lines, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage of your black mage spells.

classFeature.name: Between the Lines
entries: When you reach 10th level, you become able to manipulate your ley lines in the following ways. To use either effect, you must be within 120 feet of your ley lines.

items: As a bonus action, you can teleport to the center of your ley lines.
As an action, you reweave your ley lines, causing it to disappear from it’s current location and reappear centered on you. You can do so only once each time you create your ley lines.

classFeature.name: Soul Resonance
entries: When you reach 20th level, your soul becomes attuned with the very fabric of magic itself. While standing in your ley lines, you gain the following effects:
{@b {@i Apocatastasis.}} Any damage you take is reduced by your Ley Line Bonus.
{@b {@i Transpose.}} You can use a bonus action to change your current aether alignment to either astral phase or umbral phase.
{@b {@i Apocatastasis.}} Your concentration can’t be broken by taking damage.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the black mage spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the black mage spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the black mage spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the black mage spell list

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this class’s Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the black mage spell list

classFeature.name: Battle Voice
entries: You can infuse your voice with power to strengthen the resolve of your allies. Starting at 1st level, you can use your action to invoke your Battle Voice. Choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you that can hear you, up to your Charisma modifier (you can choose yourself). The chosen creatures gain 1d6 + your Charisma modifier temporary hit points and can add a d6 to the next damage roll they make before the end of their next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach 9th level the d6s increase to d8s and at 17th level they become d10s.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: Also at 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 6th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: At 6th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Repetoire
entries: At 2nd level, you are able to perform enchanted battlesongs to affect the battlefield. You start knowing two battlesongs: Army’s Paeon and Wanderer’s Minuet.

You can use a bonus action to begin performing a battlesong you know. The performance lasts for 1 minute, or until you are incapacitated or begin performing another battlesong. You can perform each battlesong you know once, and regain the ability to do so after finishing a short or long rest.

Each battlesong you know imparts an effect to friendly or enemy creatures, as specified in its description. A creature must be within 30 feet of you and be able to hear you to be affected by your battlesong. Your battlesongs also make use of a Repetoire Bonus, which begins as a +1 bonus. Your Repetoire Bonus increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Repetoire Bonus column of the Bard table.

classFeature.name: Army's Paeon
entries: A stirring song to lift the spirits of soldiers in battle. When you or a friendly creature that can hear the song makes a weapon attack roll, the creature can add your Repetoire Bonus to the roll.

classFeature.name: Wanderer's Minuet
entries: A rousing song to energise your allies. You and friendly creatures that start their turn able to hear your song have their movement speed increased by 5 times your repetoire bonus.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Also at 2nd level you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Bard Troupe
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a bard troupe to join, acquiring their unique skills and ideals. Choose from the Doom Singer, God’s Bows, Spell Singer, Troubadour or Wood Warden troupes. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to bards. This replacement represents a shift of focus in your martial practice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to bards. This replacement represents a shift of focus in your martial practice.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
