items: At 14th level, lightning magic lashes out from your ley lines. Any creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of your ley lines must make a Constitution saving throw, suffering one of the following effects of your choice on a failed save.
{@b {@i Lightning.}} The creature takes lightning damage equal to your black mage level.
{@b {@i Thunder.}} The creature is pushed back 15 feet and is deafened until the end of your next turn.
When you create your ley lines, you can choose any number of creatures you can see to be immune to this feature for the duration.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderhead
entries: From 18th level, your ley lines serve as a conduit for thunderous power. Choose a spell of 2nd level or lower from the black mage spell list that deals either lightning or thunder damage. While standing in your ley lines, you can cast your chosen spell at its lowest level without expending a spell slot. When you finish a long rest, you can change your swap out your chosen spell for another spell of 2nd level or lower that deals lightning or thunder damage. If the weather around you is a thunderstorm, you can instead do so as an action.

subclassFeature.name: Frontliner Training
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency in medium armor and shields and with battleaxes, flails and longswords.

subclassFeature.name: Bursting Blade
entries: When you join this troupe at 3rd level, you become able to infuse your weapon with power. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d6 thunder damage and disorient the creature until the start of your next turn. While disoriented, the creature has disadvantage on opportunity attacks.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses after finishing a long rest.
When you reach 9th level, the extra damage die increases to a d8, and at 17th level, it increases to a d10.

subclassFeature.name: Frontliner's March
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the battlesong Frontliner’s March, a rallying song to bolster blades. A friendly creature that can hear your song adds your Repetoire Bonus to the damage of it’s melee weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Long March
entries: Starting at 7th level, you are able to keep up the morale of your allies. While travelling, you and your allies can travel for an additional 4 miles in a single day. Moreover, you and your allies have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion caused by a forced march, and when you finish a short rest, you and any other creature that took the short rest with you can reduce their exhaustion level by one.

subclassFeature.name: Shoulder to Shoulder
entries: Starting at 10th level, your allies are at their strongest when stood beside you. When a creature would gain the benefit of one of your battlesongs, your repetoire bonus for that creature increases by +1 if it is within 5 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Charge
entries: When you reach 14th level, you charge into the fray with your allies. When you roll initiative and aren’t surprised, you can immediately use Battle Voice without expending a use.

subclassFeature.name: Echo of Life
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to cause a creature within 30 feet of you to regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier. Then, a creature of your choice within 30 feet of that creature regains half as many hit points.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after finishing a long rest.
When you reach 9th level, the d6 becomes a d8, and when you reach 17th level, it becomes a d10.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Minne
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the battlesong Nature’s Minne, a soothing song to cure wounds. A friendly creature that can hear your song adds your Repetoire Bonus to any healing it receives.

subclassFeature.name: Protected Respite
entries: At 7th level, you can create a performance to call upon the elementals for protection while resting. At the start of a short rest or long rest, you can begin the performance, which lasts for 10 minutes. At the end of the performance, make a Charisma (Performance) check. The result of the check determines how the elementals respond to you,
{@b {@i 9 or below.}} The elementals are unmoved by your performance and take no action.

{@b {@i 10 to 14.}} You and your companions can’t be surprised for the duration of the rest, and the elementals magically awaken you and your companions if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.
{@b {@i 15 to 19.}} As above, and the elementals grant you and your allies a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks for the duration of the rest.

{@b {@i 20 or higher.}} As above, and the elementals project an invisible 30-foot-sphere of protective magic centered on you, preventing any creature from entering the area other than you and your allies for the duration of the rest.

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Voice
entries: Starting at 10th level, your voice is laced with healing magic. Whenever you use Battle Voice or begin performing a battlesong, you and creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you regain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Song of Salvation
entries: When you reach 15th level, the elementals can flow through you for a brief time to turn the tide of battle. As an action, you can begin a performance that lasts until the end of your next turn. While the performance is active, friendly creatures within 30 feet of you can’t be reduced below 1 hit point, and when a friendly creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you, it regains hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Doom Voice
entries: From 3rd level, when you use Battle Voice, you can also choose a number of hostile creatures up to your Charisma modifier within 30 feet of you and force them to make a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.) On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. While frightened this way, the creature’s maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier + your Bard level. If a frightened creature is more than 30 feet away from you, or can no longer hear you, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Hysteria Dirge
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the battlesong Hysteria Dirge, a morbid song to weaken foes. A hostile creature that can hear your song subtracts your repetoire bonus from any saving throw it makes.

subclassFeature.name: Song of Regret
entries: At At 7th level, you can create a mournful performance that compels a creature to answer your questions. The performance lasts for 10 minutes. At the end of the performance, choose one creature that witnessed the entire performance. That creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or it becomes overwhelmed by guilt and sorrow and is compelled to blurt out the answer to a question of your choosing. You know if the creature is telling the truth when it answers.

subclassFeature.name: Voice of Mourning
entries: Starting at 10th level, when a hostile creature enters the radius of a battlesong you are playing on its turn, or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your Doom Voice save DC or become overwhelmed by misery. Its speed becomes zero until the start of its next turn. A creature frightened of you has disadvantage on the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Finality
entries: Starting at 15th level, the end of your songs brings the ends of days. During your Radiant Final, the radius of your Battle Voice and Battlesongs is doubled. Moreover, when a creature fails the saving throw against Doom Voice or Voice of Mourning during Radiant Finale, it takes necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Godsbow
entries: A group that once splintered from the God’s Quiver in Gridania, bards of this troupe have chosen to cling to their roots in archery. To the Godsbow Troupe, the string of a lute is no different to that of a bow. They still retain their old rivalry with the God’s Quiver, however, with the two organisations striving to prove who is the superior marksman.

subclassFeature.name: Refulgent Arrow
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you make a ranged weapon attack that beats the target’s AC by 5 or more, your weapon becomes empowered with refulgent power until the end of your next turn. The first ranged weapon attack you make while your weapon is empowered this way deals an additional 1d6 damage and scores a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19 or 20 on the d20. It also counts as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity. The effect ends immediately after making the weapon attack. The extra damage increases to 1d8 when you reach 9th level, and again to 1d10 when you reach 17th level.
Additionally, you can use a bonus action to automatically empower a weapon you are holding with refulgent power. You can do so twice and regain all expended uses after finishing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arrow's Aria
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the battlesong Arrow’s Aria. You or a friendly creature that can hear your song adds your repetoire bonus to the damage of its ranged weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Song of the Hawk's Eye
entries: At 7th level, you learn a song that can stirr the spirit and inspire caution. At the end of a short or long rest, you can create a performance that lasts for 10 minutes. At the end of the performance, choose a number of creatures that witnessed the performance up to your Charisma modifier. You and the chosen creatures gain the following benefits until you finish a long rest:

items: The creatures gain a bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) scores equal to your Charisma modifier.
The creatures’ passive Wisdom (Perception) isn’t reduced by effects that impose disadvantage on your Wisdom (Perception) checks.
The creatures gain a bonus to the first Wisdom (Perception) check they make before this effect ends equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Blast Arrow
entries: Starting at 10th level, your Refulgant Arrow attacks ignore half and three quarters cover. Moreover, when you make a Refulgent Arrow attack, regardless of if the attack hits or misses creatures in a straight line between you and the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus), taking the weapon’s damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Empyreal Arrow
entries: At 14th level, your music hastens your bowstring. When use a bonus action to begin performing a battlesong, you can make a ranged weapon attack as part of the same bonus action. If you then make another weapon attack against that creature on the same turn, the attack has advantage.
Additionally, when you begin a radiant finale, you can make a single ranged weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you augment your skills with the ability to cast spells.
{@b {@i Cantrips.}} You learn two cantrips of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. You learn an additional sorcerer cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

{@b {@i Spell Slots.}} The Spell Singer Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your sorcerer spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell’s level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell Shield and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast Shield using either slot.

{@b {@i Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher.}} You know three 1st-level sorcerer spells of your choice, two of which you must choose from the enchantment and evocation spells on the sorcerer spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Spell Singer Spellcasting table shows when you learn more sorcerer spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an enchantment or evocation spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the sorcerer spells you know with another spell of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an enchantment or evocation spell, unless you’re replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level from any school of magic.

{@b {@i Song Casting.}} As you cast your spells through the power of your voice, sorcerer spells you cast require only a verbal component instead of their usual spellcasting components. However, if a spell has a material component with a gold cost, you must still supply that component.

{@b {@i Spellcasting Ability.}} Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your sorcerer spells, since you invoke your spells through the power of voice and song. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a sorcerer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Mage's Ballad
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the battlesong Mage’s Ballad, an arcane song to bolster spells. A friendly creature that can hear your song adds your repetoire bonus to the damage of its spells.

subclassFeature.name: Ritual Performance
entries: Starting at 7th level, you become able to perform rituals as if they were a song. Choose two spells from the sorcerer spell list that can be cast as a ritual. Your chosen spells don’t count towards the number of spells you know, and you can only cast these spells as a ritual. When you do so, they require only verbal components and any material components with a gold cost.
When you reach 15th level, you can choose a third ritual spell from the sorcerer spell list to learn.

subclassFeature.name: Voice of Song and Spell
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you use your action to cast a spell, you can use Battle Voice as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Distant Voice
entries: From 15th level, you can use a mote of magic to throw your voice further. When you use Battle Voice or cast a spell with a verbal component, you can cause the effect to originate from a space you can see within 30 feet of you, as if you were standing there. Additionally, when you begin performing a battlesong, you can choose a friendly creature within 30 feet of you. The effects of the song originate from that creature, instead of you, for the duration of the song or until you use a bonus action to return it to yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Marksman Industry
entries: The marksman industry is a convocation of machinist that focus their research into developing their firearm technology and skills. These machinist excel in targetting vital areas to cripple their foes and controlling the battlefield through an unparalleled skill with firearms. To them, the most important and reliable piece of technology they have is the humble weapon in their hands.

subclassFeature.name: Graze Scope
entries: At 3rd level, you have designed a new gadget, the graze scope. When you make a ranged attack using a firearm or gadget, you can spend 10 battery points as a bonus action to activate the scope. When you activate the scope, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack roll, and if the attack hits, you can choose one of the following effects to inflict on the target:
***Head.*** The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Gadget save DC, or be blinded until the end of your next turn.
***Legs.*** The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Gadget save DC, or be knocked prone.
***Arms.*** The creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Gadget save DC, or be forced to drop one item of your choice that it's holding.

When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die. Additionally, if you know the *Barrel Stabilizer* or *Silencer* gadgets, you can activate them as part of the same bonus action to activate the Graze Scope.

subclassFeature.name: Keen Eye
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Perception skill. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to make a Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a hidden creature.

subclassFeature.name: Supressive Fire
entries:
By 7th level, you've learned how to keep your foes at
bay. When a creature you can see moves more than 5 feet while within the normal range of a firearm you are holding, you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack against it using the firearm.

subclassFeature.name: Marksman's Spite
entries:
Starting at 11th level, ranged weapon attacks you
make against a creature suffering from the blinded, charmed, frightened, grappled, restrained or stunned conditions can never have disadvantage. Additionally, when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack and the attack roll beats the target's AC by 5 or more, the attack deals an additional 1d10 damage.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Draw
entries: By 14th level, your reactions have become more honed than most. You have advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, you have advantage on all weapon attacks you make using a firearm during the first round of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Aetherology Study
entries: Aetherology is the study of magic, in all its forms. Sages of this discipline focus not on specific types of spells, but rather, the improvement of their spellcasting as a whole. By mastering the fundamentals of magic, they are able to empower their own magic, as well as defend themselves and their allies from spells.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Eukrasia
entries: In your studies of the arcane, you have mastered simple yet powerful spells, and have learned how to augment them. When you choose this study at 2nd level, you gain the following two Eukrasia options.

***Eukrasian Ankylosis.*** You learn the *magic missile* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, combining each of the darts into a single bolt of force and directing it at a creature you can see within range. The target takes 1d6 + 1 damage for each dart that the spell would have created.

***Eukrasian Osteosis.*** You learn the *mage armour* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it by reinforcing the armour. The duration of the spell changes to 1 minute. For the duration, the target has resistance to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

When you reach 3rd level, you
gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Whoosis.*** You learn the
*misty step* spell. When you cast the spell, you can
expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, and fade
from the immedate memories of those around you.
You become invisible until the start of your next turn,
or until you attack or cast a spell.
When you reach 5th level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Osmosis.*** You learn the *dispel magic* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it to capture and redirect some of the dispelled energy. One creature you can see regains 1d6 hit points for each level of the dispelled spell.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip Savant
entries:
Also at 2nd level, you have learned and mastered some simple cantrips. When you gain this feature, choose one of the following cantrips: *dosis*, *mage hand*, or *resistance*. You learn that cantrip if you don't already know it, and it doesn't count against the number of sage cantrips you know. If you already know your chosen cantrip, you learn
one additional cantrip from the sage spell list.

When you cast your chosen cantrip, you can do
so with the modification listed below.

***Dosis.*** When you cast the spell, you can choose to target multiple creatures, instead of just one. Make an attack roll against a number of creatures up to your proficiency bonus. On a hit, each creature takes 1d6 force damage.
***Mage Hand.*** When you cast the spell, you can do so as a bonus action. Additionally, you can control the hand using a bonus action, rather than an action.
***Resistance.*** When you cast the spell, you can do so as a bonus action. When you do so, the spell can only target you, and doesn't require concentration.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Ward
entries:
Starting at 6th level, you have resistance
to damage from spells. Moreover, when a
creature you can see within 15 feet takes damage
from a spell, you can use your reaction extend this
benefit to them, granting the creature resistance to damage from spells (including the triggering spell)
until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip Master
entries: At 10th level, you can choose a second option from the Cantrip Savant feature. Additionally, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage you deal with any sage cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Swiftcast
entries: When you reach 14th level, you learn how to swiftly cast certain spells. When you augment a spell using Eukrasia that has a casting time of 1 action, you can change the casting time to 1 bonus action for that casting.

subclassFeature.name: Illicitology Study
entries: Among sages, there are some who are not sated by the education they recieve, some who are not satisfied with the power they wield. These sages delve deep into the forbidden mysteries of the world, gathering dark and sinister knowledge deemed illicit by the Forum.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Eukrasia
entries: In your studies of forbidden magic, you have learned dark spells, and the means of twisting them to suit you. When you choose this study at 2nd level, you gain the following two Eukrasia options.

***Eukrasian Abiosis.*** You learn the *arms of hadar* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, causing the tendrils to wrap around your foes. Creatures that fail the spells saving throw become restrained until

the start of your
next turn. Creatures that
succeed the saving throw instead have
their movement speed reduced by 15 feet.

***Eukrasian Hallucinosis.*** You learn the *cause fear* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it. Instead of becoming frightened of you, the target becomes frightened of another creature of your choice that is within range of the spell.
When you reach 3rd level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Morphosis.*** You learn the *alter self* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, further twisting your form. You gain the benefit of two of the spell's options, rather than only one.
When you reach 5th level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Toxicosis.*** You learn the *toxicon* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, changing the magic into something toxic. Creatures that fail the saving throw against the spell become poisoned until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Augmentation
entries: Also at 2nd level, your extensive studies of the forbidden arts has unearthed a sinister ritual designed to empower a creature's body, at the expense of it's mind. As an action, you touch a willing creature and empower it for 1 minute. An empowered creature gains the following benefits:
- The creature's speed increases by 15 feet
- The creature gains a climbing and swimming speed equal to it's walking speed.
- The creature has resistance to one damage type of your choice.
- At the start of each of the creature's turns, it gains temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Repeated exposure to this magic can cause a creature to go mad. If a creature is empowered by this feature twice before taking a long rest, it must make a Charisma saving throw when the effect ends. On a failed save, the creature is afflicted with long-term madness.

subclassFeature.name: Sap Magic
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points using a spell of 2nd level or higher, you regain one expended spell slot. The slot you regain must be of a level
lower than the spell you cast and can't be higher than 5th level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Augmentation
entries: When you reach 10th level, you find ways of improving the dark ritual you have unearthed. A creature empowered by your Dark Augmentation gains the following additional benefits:
- The creature's spells and weapon attacks deal an additional 1d8 force damage.
- The creature is immune to two of the following conditions of your choice: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened or poisoned.

subclassFeature.name: Suspended Cycle
entries: At 14th level, you learn how to break the natural cycle of death for just a moment. When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet is reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to delay that creature's death until the end of the creature's next turn. During this time, having 0 hit points doesn't knock the creature unconscious, and the creature doesn't make death saving throws. If the creature kills another creature before the end of their next turn, they immediately regain 1 hit point, and their death is prevented. If the creature ends its turn without having killed another creature, then it immediately falls unconscious and makes death saving throws as normal.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 6th level or higher to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Vivology Study
entries: Sages that study vivology study the mysteries of life, and how to best preserve it. Vivology students delve deeper into the healing arts, and learn valuable magical techniques they apply alongside their training. These techniques allow them to efficiently heal others, but additionally, they can be used to proactively defend and protect others against harm.

subclassFeature.name: Medicinal Eukrasia
entries: In your studies of healing, you have learned powerful healing spells to keep yourself and your allies alive. When you choose this study at 2nd level, you gain the following two Eukrasia options.

***Eukrasian Diagnosis.*** You learn the *cure wounds* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, transmuting the healing magic into defensive shielding. Instead of being healed, the target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to twice the amount it would have regained normally.

***Eukrasian Leukosis.*** You learn the *healing word* spell.When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, infusing life magic into the target. For 1 minute, the target's maxmimum hit points increases by an amount equal to the number of hit points healed by the spell
When you reach 3rd level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Prognosis.*** You learn the *prayer of healing* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, accelerating it's casting time. The casting time of the spell changes to 1 action.
When you reach 5th level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Apotheosis*** You learn the *revivify* spell. When you cast this spell, you can choose to augment the  spell by empowering the target. When the creature returns to life, it regains an additional 4d6 hit points, and has resistance to all damage until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Kardia
entries: Also at 2nd level, you learn how to channel destructive magic into gradual healing. As a bonus action, you can forge an aetheric link between yourself and a creature you can see within 60 feet. For 1 minute, any time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points or deals damage, you can cause the linked creature to regain hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

You can have only one creature linked at a time. The link breaks if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if you form a link with another creature. You can also end the link as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Esuna
entries: By 6th level, you've learned how to magically cure simple diseases with ease. As an action, you can touch a creature and end one non-magical disease currently afflicting it.

Additionally, you also learn how to magically cure complex conditions. As an action, you can touch a creature and end one condition or negative effect caused by a spell of 3rd level or lower afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed or poisoned.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Kardia
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you restore hit points to a creature using your Kardia feature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to the level of the spell that was cast.

subclassFeature.name: Techne Makre
entries: At 14th level, you unearth an powerful technique passed down by ancient healers. As an action, you manifest the visage of a towering, ethereal tree in an unoccupied space you can see. The tree is a large object with AC equal to your Spell Save DC  and 50 hit points. The tree manifests for 1 minute, or until you are incapacitated or you choose to dismiss it as a bonus action.

When you summon the tree, a ripple of healing energy emanates from it, causing each creature of your choice within 120 feet of the tree to regain 4d6 hit points. At the start of each of your turns while the tree is manifested, the ripple of healing energy repeats, restoring 2d6 hit points to creatures of your choice within 120 feet of the tree.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 7th level or higher to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Gravitology Study
entries: Gravity is an ever-present, fundamental aspect of the universe. Some Sages choose to dedicate themselves to understanding the mysteries and powers surrounding this primeval force of nature, thereby becoming students of Gravitology. In their quest for knowledge, they uncover secrets that allow them to harness this power, and ascend beyond the chains that bind themself and others to the earth.

subclassFeature.name: Gravity Eukrasia
entries: In your studies of gravity, you have learned of spells to manipulate the natural forces, and how to modifiy them. When you choose this study at 2nd level, you gain the following two Eukrasia options.

***Eukrasian Mitosis.*** You learn the *magnify gravity* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it. You split the magic in two, creating two 10-foot radii, rather than only one. When you do so, each radius deals only half as much damage.

***Eukrasian Proptosis.*** You learn the *feather fall* spell. WWhen you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, allowing the targets to displace their own movement. Each creature affected by the spell can immediately move up to their speed.
When you reach 3rd level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Zoonosis.***  You learn the *kinetic jaunt* spell.When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, allowing the magic to flow from one creature to another. The range of the spell becomes Touch, and any creature affected by the spell can use their action to touch another creature, transferring the effect to them instead.
When you reach 5th level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.
***Eukrasian Cyclosis.*** You learn the *pulse wave* spell. When you cast the spell, you can augment it, doubling the pull or push distance for the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Accretion Disk
entries: From 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to manifest an accretion disk, a whirling ring of magic, gravity and rubble that flows around you in a 10-foot radius sphere. The disk lasts for 1 minute, or until you are knocked unconscious or dismiss it as a bonus action. While the disk is active, you gain the following benefits.
- When a creature starts its turn in the radius of the disk, it takes 1d6 force damage.
- Each time you cast a spell, the radius of the disk increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 30 feet.

- You can use your action to condense the disk and launch it at a creature within 60 feet. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 1d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The damage increases to 2d6 if the radius of the disk is at least 15 feet, or to 4d6 if the radius is at least 30 feet. When you take this action, your accretion disk ends.

subclassFeature.name: Icarus
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can use your bonus action to touch a creature and grant them a flying speed of 30 feet and the ability to hover for 1 minute, or until you use this feature again.
You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Whirling Defence
entries: When you reach 10th level, your accretion disk allows you to redirect and absorb attacks. When an attack misses you while your accretion disk is active, you can use your reaction to redirect the attack. If the attack was a ranged attack, you can choose a creature within 60 feet of you. If the attack was a melee attack, choose a creature within 5 feet of you. The chosen creature becomes the new target of the attack.
Alternatively, you can use your reaction to absorb the attack, increasing the radius of your accretion disk by 5 feet, up to a maximum of 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Gravitic Flux
entries: At 14th level, you are able to unleash the full force of gravity on your enemies. As an action, you create an area of unstable gravity in a 15-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within 60 feet. Creatures in that area are immediately flung 30 feet into the air, and are suspended there until the end of your next turn. While suspended, a creature can only move if it has a flying speed.

While the creatures are suspended, you can use your action to slam the creatures into the ground, forcing each creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 8d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, but is still knocked prone.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 6th level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Dracology Study
entries: Dragons are great, terrible and might creatures. Towering beasts of scale and claw, possessed of fiery breaths and the power of flight. Indeed, these creatures inspire awe, and occasionally fealty, in those that witness them. Likewise, their power and mystique drive some to learn everything about them that they can. Whether they intend to use this information to destroy them, protect others from them, or to use their power for other gains, Sages that follow this discipline seek understanding so as to use the power of dragons for themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Eukrasia
entries: In your studies of dragons, you have learned of spells to mimic the powers of dragons, and the means to modify them. When you choose this study at 2nd level, you gain the following two Eukrasia options.

***Eukrasian Chromatosis.*** You learn the *absorb elements* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it by funneling the captured energy into your defences. The duration of the spell becomes 1 minute, and instead of the first weapon melee attack on your next turn dealing additional damage, you gain 1d6 temporary hit points, plus 1d6 additional temporary hit points for each level of the spell above 1st.

***Eukrasian Apoptosis.*** You learn the *chromatic orb* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, making the orb unstable. After you make the spell attack, regardless of if it hits or misses, the target and each creature within 15 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking the spells damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
When you reach 3rd level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Halitosis.***  You learn the *dragon's breath* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it. When you do so, you don't need to concentrate on the spell, and the spell lasts for its full duration. Additionally, the damage type can be any type other than bludgeoning, piercing or slashing.
When you reach 5th level, you gain the following Eukrasia option.

***Eukrasian Diarthrosis.*** You learn the *ashardalon's stride* spell. When you cast the spell, you can expend a use of Eukrasia to augment it, causing the billowing flames to manifest into wings. Rather than increasing your speed, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Artificial Eye
entries: At 2nd level, having deciphered that a dragon's power stems from its eyes, you have created an artificial replica to mimic draconic powers. Your artificial eye is a wellspring of magical power, with a number of uses equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one). You can give the eye to another creature, but it can't use it unless you gave it willingly. A creature holding your artificial eye can use it in the following ways:

- Once per turn, when the creature deals damage to another creature or object, it can expend a use to deal additional damage equal to 1d6 + half your sage level. The damage type is its choice of acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
- When the creature makes a Strength, Dexterity or Constitution check, it can expend a use to add a d6 to the roll.

Your artificial eye regains all expended uses when you finish a long rest. You can also use a bonus action while holding the eye and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to recharge the eye, restoring a number of uses equal to the level of the expended spell slot, up to it's maximum.

If you lose your artificial eye, you can perform work over the course of 1 hour to develop a new one. This work can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous eye. The eye is also destroyed when you die.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Defence
entries: At 6th level, you are able to call upon your artificial eye to improve your defences. When you finish a long rest, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. A creature holding your artificial eye has resistance to the chosen type. Additionally, when the creature is targeted by an attack roll or Dexterity saving throw, it can expend a use as a reaction to sprout draconic scales that ward off the attack. The creature has half cover until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sight of the First Brood
entries: At 10th level, the power of your artificial eye grows, granting any creature holding it truesight out to 15 feet. As a bonus action, the creature can expend a use of your artificial eye to increase the distance to 60 feet for 1 minute, or until they are no longer holding the eye.

subclassFeature.name: Twin Gaze
entries: At 14th level, your pool of aether has swelled in size, allowing you to construct and maintain a second artificial eye. Each of your artificial eyes has its own separate pool of uses.

optionalfeature.name: Discordant Fighter
entries: You infuse your voice with magic to fight. You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} and {@spell prestidigitation} cantrips. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.

optionalfeature.name: Gunner
entries: The damage die of your gunblade’s Lightning Shot increases to {@dice 1d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Provoker
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to provoke the creature until the start of your next turn. While provoked, the creature has disadvantage on attacks rolls against creatures other than you.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Wizard spell list. They count as dark knight spells for you, and Charisma is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the Wizard spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Arm of the Destroyer
entries: {@b Form:} Opo-Opo

When you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to you strike the ground with devastating force. Creatures within 30 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 thunder damage for each chakra you spent, and is pushed back 15 feet. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is only pushed back 5 feet.
If you use this technique while at least 10 feet in the air, you come crashing down, increasing the radius to 60 feet and subtracting up to 50 feet from the fall when calculating the fall damage.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Revolution
entries: {@b Form:} Opo-Opo

When you make an unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to deliver a sweeping skyward moonsault against a creature within reach. You can make the attack against any creature that is up to 30 feet above you. On a hit, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} damage for each chakra spent, and if it is flying, it must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Demolish
entries: {@b Form:} Coeurl

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to sunder its defences. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, its AC is reduced by an amount equal to the number of chakra you spent for 1 minute. On a successful save, its AC is only reduced by half the amount, and the effect ends at the start of the creature’s next turn. If you have advantage on the attack, then the creature has disadvantage on its saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Kick
entries: {@b Form:} Opo-Opo

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to deliver a devastating blow. The target takes an extra 1d6 damage for each chakra spent, or {@damage 1d10} if the attack beat the target’s AC by 5 or more.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir Field
entries: {@b Form:} Coeurl

When you take the attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to blast a gale of concentrated aether in either a 30-foot long, 5-feet wide line, or in a 30-foot radius around you. Creatures caught in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d12} radiant damage for each chakra spent on the attack, or half as much on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Flint Strike
entries: {@b Form:} Coeurl

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to release a burst of flame. The target and each creature of your choice within 5 feet of it other than you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 1d6 fire damage for each chakra spent on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Four-Point Fury
entries: {@b Form:} Raptor

When you take the attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to deliver a sweeping kick around you. Creatures within 15 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 damage for each chakra you spent, and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Haymaker
entries: {@b Form:} Opo-Opo

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to deliver a concussive blow. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature cannot take reactions and can only take an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last until the end of your next turn. For each additional chakra spent beyond the first, the duration increases by one round, and the creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Howling Fist
entries: {@b Form:} Opo-Opo

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to deliver the blow with the force of the wind. The creature and each creature in a 60-foot long, 5-feet wide line behind it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creatures take 1d6 thunder damage for each chakra spent and are deafened. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

optionalfeature.name: One Ilm Punch
entries: {@b Form:} Opo-Opo

When you make a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to deliver an accurate, debilitating strike to the target. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you end one beneficial spell on the creature. The spell must be of a level equal to or lower than the number of chakra spent.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Rush
entries: {@b Form:} Raptor

As an action, you channel chakra to vanish and strike like a phantom. Choose a number of creatures up to the number of chakra spent within 30 feet of you. Make a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike against each target, each of which deals an additional {@damage 1d8} force damage. If an attack misses, it deals half damage instead of no damage. You can then teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of one of the targets.

optionalfeature.name: Rising Phoenix
entries: {@b Form:} Coeurl

As an action, you rise up in a gout of flame. Creatures within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 1d6 fire damage for each chakra spent on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

You then rise 15 feet into the air, along with any creature that failed their Strength saving throw. You only fall at the end of your next turn, and you don’t take fall damage when you fall this way. A creature that fails the saving throw falls as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Rockbreaker
entries: {@b Form:} Coeurl

When you take the attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to deliver a pulverizing shockwave in a 15-foot cube in front of you. Creatures caught in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d8 thunder damage for each chakra spent and has its speed recuced to 5 feet until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect. A nonmagical object that isn’t being worn or carried takes double the damage if its in the area.

optionalfeature.name: Steel Peak
entries: {@b Form:} Coeurl

When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra to deliver a strike at the target’s vitals. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or be stunned until the end of your next turn. For each additional chakra spent beyond the first, the duration increases by one round. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Six-Sided Star
entries: {@b Form:} Raptor

As an action, you channel chakra and move up to 15 feet for each chakra spent. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. If you come within reach of another creature during that move, you can make one melee weapon attack or unarmed strike against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Tornado Kick
entries: {@b Form:} Raptor

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can deliver a strike with the force of a tornado. The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} thunder damage for each chakra spent and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is pushed back 5 feet for each chakra spent, or half as far on a successful save. You can then move up to your speed to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Death
entries: {@b Form:} Opo-Opo

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can spend chakra and force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it becomes afflicted with lingering agony, taking 1d4 necrotic damage for each chakra spent, and must repeat the save at the end of each of its turns for the next minute, ending the effect on a success. Each time the creature fails the save, you roll one less d4 the next time it takes damage from this effect, to a minimum of 1d4. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

optionalfeature.name: Twin Snakes
entries: {@b Form:} Raptor

When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can deliver a deadly strike that turns the target’s own aether into a poison. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes poisoned until the end of your next turn. While poisoned this way, the target also has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell. For each additional chakra spent beyond the first, the duration increases by one round, and the poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Air Anchor
entries: You have developed a harpoon capable of grounding airborne targets. As an action, you can spend 10 battery points to fire the air anchor at a target you can see within 90 feet of you. Make a ranged gadget attack. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 piercing damage, and it’s flying speed (if any) is reduce to 0 feet until the end of your next turn.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Armed Explosive
entries: You have created a small but powerful explosive device. As an action, you can spend 15 battery points to place the explosive in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. When you do so, the explosive buries itself into the ground and becomes hidden. Another creature can spot the explosive with a successful Wisdom (Perception) check against your gadget save DC. The explosive persists for 8 hours before it runs out of charge and becomes nonfunctional.

When a creature steps into the explosive’s space, it detonates. You can also detonate the explosive manually using a bonus action. When the explosive detonates, all creatures within 5 feet of the explosive must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
When the explosive detonates, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Auto Crossbow
entries: You have created a powerful automatic crossbow that can deal damage over a wide area. As an action, you can spend 10 battery points to unleash the auto crossbow. Creatures in a 30-foot cone before you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Barrel Stabilizer
entries: You have designed a barrel stabilizer for use with your firearms. As a bonus action, you can spend 5 battery points to attach the stabilizer to a firearm you are holding. The next weapon attack you make using the firearm before the end of your turn ignores disadvantage caused by a hostile creature standing within 5 feet of you.
When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Bioblaster
entries: You have created a potent chemical spewing weapon, the bioblaster. As an action, you can spend 15 battery points to unleash the bioblaster in a 30-foot cone in front of you. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 poison damage and is poisoned. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t poisoned.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Bishop Autoturret
entries: You have designed a small autonomous turret to fight beside you. As an action, you can spend 15 battery points to place the turret in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The turret counts as a small object with AC 15 and 20 hit points. The turret persists until the end of your next turn, at which point it powers off and must be placed again. When you start your turn, you can spend 5 battery points to extend the turret’s duration until the end of your next turn. When you place the turret, and again at the start of each of your turns while the turret persists, the turret grants the nearest allied creature within 60 feet of it 2d6 temporary hit points.
When you activate this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Blank Shot
entries: You have created a specialised weapon for pushing back your enemies. As an action, you can spend 5 battery points to fire the weapon. One creature of your choice within 5 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pushed back up to 15 feet and knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature is pushed back 5 feet and isn’t knocked prone.
When you activate this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Saw
entries: You have designed a potent weapon capable of launching saw blades at high speed. As an action, you can spend 10 battery points to unleash the chain saw. Creatures in a line 5-feet wide and 30-feet long before you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d8 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
When you activate this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Cloaking Device
entries: You have designed a specialised device capable of rendering anything invisible. As an action, you can spend 20 battery points to activate the cloaking device. You and creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you become invisible for up to 1 minute. The effect ends early if you or any other creature affected by this gadget move, attack, cast a spell, or use any feature that forces another creature to make a saving throw.
When you activate this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Coilgun
entries: You have designed a potent weapon capable of firing metal rods at high speeds. As an action on your turn, you can spend 15 battery points to fire the coilgun at a creature or object you can see within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged gadget attack. On a hit, the target takes 6d4 piercing damage. On a miss, the target takes half as much damage.
When you activate this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision Goggles
entries: You have designed a set of specialised goggles to see in the dark. As a bonus action, you can spend 5 battery points to activate the goggles for 1 hour. While active, the goggles grant you darkvision out to 120 feet.
When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Debilitator
entries: You have created a powerful device that can cripple your foes. As an action, you can spend 20 battery points to activate the debilitator and target a creature you can see within 60 feet. Choose from acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes debilitated for 1 minute. When a debilitated creature takes damage of the chosen type, it takes an additional 2d6 damage of the chosen type.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Defibrilator
entries: You have designed a device capable of pulling a creature back from the brink of death. As an action, you can spend 10 battery points and touch a creature that has 0 hit points. The creature immediately becomes stable and regains 1 hit point.
When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Dismantle
entries: You have designed a powerful mechanism that can destroy your foes defences. As an action, you can spend 20 battery points to activate the machine and target a creature you can see within 60 feet. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature’s Armor Class is reduced by 2 for 1 minute.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Drill
entries: You have created a potent weapon that can fire drills at your foes. As an action, you can spend 10 battery points to fire the weapon. Make a ranged gadget attack against a creature or object you can see within 30 feet. This attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 piercing damage, or 2d10 piercing damage if the attack was a critical hit.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Flamethrower
entries: You have created a powerful device capable of spewing flames at your foes. As an action, you can spend 20 battery points to unleash the flamethrower and blast a gale of flame in a 60-foot cone in front of you. Each creature caught in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
If you used this gadget during your last turn, you can activate it again for 10 battery points instead of the usual cost.
When you use this gadget, you gain three heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Flashbang
entries: You have designed a potent explosive that can blind foes. As an action, you can spend 15 battery points to activate and throw the flashbang at a point you can see within 30 feet. Any creature within 5 feet of the chosen point must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded and deafened until the start of their next turn. On a failed save, a creature is only deafened until the start of their next turn.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Freeze Ray
entries: You have invented a powerful device capable of freezing your enemies. As an action, you can spend 20 battery points to fire the freeze ray. Make a ranged gadet attack against a creature you can see within 60 feet. On a hit, the creature takes 3d12 cold damage and is restrained, as it becomes frozen in a block of ice.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Heartbreaker
entries: You have created a powerful ranged weapon capable of easily finishing off foes. As an action, you can spend 15 battery points to make an attack using the Heartbreaker. Make a ranged gadget attack against a creature within 30 feet. On a hit, a creature takes 3d6 piercing damage. If the creature has less than half it’s maximum hit points remaining, it takes an additional 3d6 damage.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Hoverboard
entries: You have created a device capable of ferrying you about the air. As an action, you can spend 15 battery points to place down and activate the hoverboard, which remains active until the start of your next turn. While the hoverboard is active, you have a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover.
When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Noise Blaster
entries: You have designed a potent device that can disorient your foes with a blast of sound. As an action, you can spend 20 battery points to activate the noise blaster and target a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes disoriented until the end of it’s next turn. A disoriented creature must use its action before moving on its turn to make a melee attack against the closest creature other than itself that it can see.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Proximity Alarm
entries: You have invented a small device to defend against unwanted intrusion. You can spend 5 battery points as a bonus action to place the device against a flat surface. When you place the device, you can designate any number of creatures that the alarm will ignore.

The alarm remains active for 8 hours once it has been placed. While active, whenever a Tiny or larger creature that hasn’t been designated to be ignored enters within a 30-foot radius of the alarm, the alarm triggers, producing the sound of a hand bell for 10 seconds that is audible out to 60 feet.
When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Rook Autoturrent
entries: You have designed a small autonomous turret to fight beside you. As an action, you can spend 15 battery points to place the turret in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The turret counts as a small object with AC 15 and 20 hit points. The turret persists until the end of your next turn, at which point it powers off and must be placed again. When you start your turn, you can spend 5 battery points to extend the turret’s duration until the end of your next turn. When you place the turret, and again at the start of each of your turns while the turret persists, the turret makes an attack against the closest hostile creature wihin 60 feet of it. The attack uses your gadget attack modifier and deals 2d6 lightning damage on a hit.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Satellite Beam
entries: You have created a potent laser fitted to a satellite drone. As an action, you can spend 20 battery points to unleash the satellite beam at a point you can see within 120 feet. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 5d10 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
When you use this gadget, you gain three heat dice.

optionalfeature.name: Silencer
entries: You have designed a silencer for use with your firearms. As a bonus action, you can spend 5 battery points to attach the silencer to a firearm you are holding. Until the end of your turn, weapon attacks made using the firearm make no noise. Additionally, when you are hidden from a creature and miss it with an attack using the firearm, making the attack doesn’t reveal your position.
When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: You have invented a small device capable of producing a thick cloud of smoke. As an action, you can spend 10 battery points to throw the smoke bomb at a point you can see within 60 feet, creating a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 25-foot radius. The smoke dissipates at the start of your next turn.
When you use this gadget, you gain a heat die.

optionalfeature.name: Stun Gun
entries: You have designed a potent weapon capable of unleashing electricity around you. You can spend 15 battery points as an action to activate the stun gun. Any creature within 5 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
When you use this gadget, you gain two heat dice.

spell.name: Collective Unconscious
entries: A sphere of cosmic light emerges from you and envelops creatures of your choice within a 30-foot sphere. The creatures you choose have resistance to all damage from attacks and effects made from outside the sphere. Creatures you didn’t choose are instead pushed out from the sphere to its edge. The spell ends if you move more than 5 feet on your turn.

spell.name: Earthly Star
entries: You conjure a blazing, miniscule star at a point you can see within range, which lasts for the duration. The star sheds bright light for 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet. When the spell ends, either because your concentration is broken or because you decide to end it, the star erupts. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on the star must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If the star lasts for at least 5 turns before erupting, its damage increases by {@damage 4d6} and the radius of the explosion increases by 20 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the starting damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Essential Dignity
entries: You call down the stars to grant succor to a creature you can see within range. The target regains {@dice 4d6} hit points, or {@dice 4d12} hit points if it has less than half of its maximum hit points remaining.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d6}/{@dice 1d12} for each spell level above 4th.

spell.name: Lightspeed
entries: You pull on the fabric of the weave to manipulate time around you. Once during the duration of this spell, you can cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action as a bonus action instead. Once you do so, the spell immediately ends.

spell.name: Malefic
entries: You conjure a facsimile of a burning star to bring harm to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The blazing radiance causes the creature to have disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every spel slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Rescue
entries: Using a tether of light, you pull one willing creature within range to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

spell.name: Blizzard
entries: Magical frost erupts in a 20-foot radius sphere around a point you can see within range. A creature in the area of the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every spel slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Flare
entries: An eruption of flame consumes a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Then, creatures within 5 feet of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage Constitution saving throw damage increases by {@dice 1d10}, and the Dexterity saving throw damage increases by 1d6 for every spel slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Flare Star
entries: A glowing mass of flame is blasted at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d10} fire damage. If the attack misses, it instead explodes in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on the target. Creatures in the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the direct hit damage increases by {@dice 1d10}, and the explosion damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every spel slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Freeze
entries: Bitter cold descends upon a creature within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 10d8} cold damage and is frozen solid for the duration. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and isn’t frozen. While frozen this way, it is incapacitated and its speed is 0. The creature is also vulnerable to fire damage. If the creature takes at least 25 points of fire damage, it thaws and the spell ends. The creature can also make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for every spel slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Paradox
entries: You conjure a column of swirling ice and fire in a 30-foot radius, 40-feet high cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. Each creature in the area of the column must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 7d6} fire damage and {@damage 7d6} cold damage, or half as much on a success.

spell.name: Unmend
entries: You loose a sphere of concentrated dark magic at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 2d10} necrotic damage, and dark magic clings to it until the end of its next turn. During that time, if the creature would regain any hit points or gain temporary hit points, it instead loses an equal number of hit points, and the effect ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Eventide
entries: You loose a tide of dark energy in two 30-foot lines, one in front of you and the other behind. Creatures caught in either line must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage and have disadvantage on all saving throws it makes before the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

spell.name: Unleash
entries: You unleash your negative emotions in a 20-foot radius around you. Creatures in the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the save has its movement speed reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn, or only 5 feet if it succeeded the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Carnal Chill
entries: You loose a burst of cold fueled by primal emotion in a 20-foot radius centered on a point you can see within range. Each creature in the radius must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw subtracts a {@dice d6} from the next damage roll it makes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ruin
entries: You channel raw destructive energy into a devastating attack. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within 120 feet. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} force damage. Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tri Disaster
entries: You conjure forth a devastating conflux of elemental energies. The area of the conflux consists of three 15-foot spheres, which you can arrange as you wish. Each sphere must be arranged within 30 feet from one another. A creature in the area of one or more of the spheres must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. Each of the spheres deals your choice of either fire, cold or lightning damage, and each one must deal a different damage type. If a creature is in the area of more than one of the spheres, you choose which sphere's damage type affects the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Dosis
entries: You fire concentrated beams of energy at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} force damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 2d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 4d4}), 11th level ({@dice 6d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 8d4})

spell.name: Haima

components.m: The discarded shell of an insect

entries: You touch a creature and erect a barrier of force around it. The creature gains 30 temporary hit points. While the creature has these hit points, it has {@quickref Cover||3||half cover}. If the creature would lose all its temporary hit points from this spell as a result of taking damage during the spells duration, you can use your bonus action on a subsequent turn to rebuild the barrier, again granting the creature temporary hit points. Each time you rebuild the barrier, the number of temporary hit points the creature gains is reduced by 5, to a minimum of 5 temporary hit points. When the spell ends, the target loses any remaining temporary hit points from this spell.

spell.name: Holos
entries: You release a wave of healing magic in every direction. Up to six creatures of your choice within range regain {@dice 4d6} hit points. The targets also gain half as many temporary hit points, which last for 1 minute.

spell.name: Mesotes
entries: A dome of magical energy forms in a 15-foot radius sphere around a point you can see within range. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures within the area of the spell to be affected by it, which can include yourself. While an affected creature is within the radius of the spell, any damage they take is reduced by 5.

spell.name: Pneuma

components.m: Complex research notes on the nature of the mortal soul

entries: You conjure a paradoxical beam of destructive and restorative magic in a line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. When you cast this spell, you can choose a number of creatures in the line to instead regain {@dice 2d10} hit points, rather than taking damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage and healing both increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Toxicon
entries: A hail of magical energy descends upon a creature within range. The target and each creature within 10 feet of the it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Zoe
entries: You draw restorative magics from the world around you to empower your next spell. The next time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature during this spells duration, you restore an additional {@dice 2d4} hit points to one creature affected by the spell, and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

item.name: Astrolabe
entries: An astrolabe, or “star globe” is a unique tool that can be used as a spellcasting focus by astrologians. Most are capable of folding away for easy storage, and float in the wielder’s hand when in use. Uniquely, the astrolabe also serves as a tool for keeping track of time and contains maps and charts of the stars above. A successful Intelligence check using the astrolabe as a tool can be used to determine the current time or the relative position of heavenly bodies.

item.name: Deck of Sixty
entries: A standard Eorzean deck of sixty cards. The deck is split into two distinct groups: the major arcana and the minor arcana. The deck is commonly used for games, fortune telling and gambling. The deck is also used by astrologians, supplying the major and minor arcana that the astrologian transforms into fate cards.

item.name: Nouliths
entries: A unique spellcasting focus that can only be used by the sages of Sharlayan. Nouliths come in an array of between 4 to 6 individual components that dart around to cast spells at the flick of the sage’s wrist.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Sprinter
entries: The chocobo can take the dash action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Gemshine
entries: While this creature is summoned, you know the {@spell produce flame} cantrip.

trait.name: Enkindle:
entries: Crimson Cyclone. When summoned, Ifrit Egi moves up to it's speed and unleashes a gale of flame in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. Roll a number of d8s equal to your PB, and add the numbers together. On a failed save, a creature takes fire damage equal to the total, or half as much on a successful save.

action.name: Burning Strike Melee Weapon Attack:
entries: {@hit 2 plus PB} to hit, reach 5ft., one target you can see. Hit {@damage 1d8 + 2 +  PB} fire damage

action.name: Inferno
entries: Ifrit Egi unleashes baleful flame in a 10-foot radius around either itself or you. Each creature caught in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 1d6 +  PB} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Gemshine
entries: While this creature is summoned, you know the {@spell magic stone|XGE} cantrip.

trait.name: Enkindle:
entries: Mountain Buster. When summoned, Titan Egi conjures the land itself to crush your foes. Choose a number of creatures up to your PB within 60 feet of Titan Egi. The chosen creatures must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d8 +  PB} bludgeoning damage and it's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of it's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

action.name: Rock Buster
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2 plus PB} to hit, reach 5ft., one target you can see. Hit {@damage 1d8 + 2 +  PB} bludgeoning damage

action.name: Earthen Armour
entries: Titan Egi draws upon earth magic to erect a powerful barrier around either itself or you. The target creature gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d10 + 2 +  PB} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Gemshine
